briefdescription.para: Maximum density of states discretization for subopt.
Typename for the subopt solution list repesenting data structure vrna_subopt_sol_s.

parblock.para: This function will be called for each suboptimal secondary structure that is successfully backtraced.

parameterdescription.para: The suboptimal secondary structure in dot-bracket notation
The free energy of the secondary structure in kcal/mol

briefdescription.para: printing threshold for use with logML

detaileddescription.para: This array contains the density of states for an RNA sequences after a call to subopt_par(), subopt() or subopt_circ().

simplesect.para: Call one of the functions subopt_par(), subopt() or subopt_circ() prior accessing the contents of this array

briefdescription.para: Returns list of subopt structures or writes to fp.

detaileddescription.para: This function produces all suboptimal secondary structures within 'delta' * 0.01 kcal/mol of the optimum, see embed:rst:inline :cite:t:`wuchty:1999` . The results are either directly written to a 'fp' (if 'fp' is not NULL), or (fp==NULL) returned in a vrna_subopt_solution_t * list terminated by an entry were the 'structure' member is NULL.

parameterdescription.para: Sort results by energy in ascending order

parblock.para: This function is attached as method subopt() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.subopt()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Generate suboptimal structures within an energy band arround the MFE.

detaileddescription.para: This is the most generic implementation of the suboptimal structure generator according to embed:rst:inline :cite:t:`wuchty:1999` . Identical to vrna_subopt(), it computes all secondary structures within an energy band delta arround the MFE. However, this function does not print the resulting structures and their corresponding free energies to a file pointer, or returns them as a list. Instead, it calls a user-provided callback function which it passes the structure in dot-bracket format, the corresponding free energy in kcal/mol, and a user-provided data structure each time a structure was backtracked successfully. This function indicates the final output, i.e. the end of the backtracking procedure by passing NULL instead of an actual dot-bracket string to the callback.

parameterdescription.para: fold compount with the sequence data
Energy band arround the MFE in 10cal/mol, i.e. deka-calories
Pointer to a callback function that handles the backtracked structure and its free energy in kcal/mol
Pointer to some data structure that is passed along to the callback

parblock.para: This function is attached as method subopt_cb() to objects of type fold_compound. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.subopt_cb()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

briefdescription.para: Returns list of subopt structures or writes to fp.

detaileddescription.para: This function produces all suboptimal secondary structures within 'delta' * 0.01 kcal/mol of the optimum. The results are either directly written to a 'fp' (if 'fp' is not NULL), or (fp==NULL) returned in a SOLUTION * list terminated by an entry were the 'structure' pointer is NULL.

memberdef.argsstring: (char *seq, char *structure, vrna_param_t *parameters, int delta, int is_constrained, int is_circular, FILE *fp)
memberdef.name: subopt_par

briefdescription.para: Returns list of subopt structures or writes to fp.
Returns list of circular subopt structures or writes to fp.

detaileddescription.para: This function is similar to subopt() but calculates secondary structures assuming the RNA sequence to be circular instead of linear

Compute Suboptimal structures according to M. Zuker, i.e. for every possible base pair the minimum energy structure containing the resp. base pair. Returns a list of these structures and their energies.

briefdescription.para: RNAsubopt and density of states declarations.
